Proud to be recognized by @HumaneSociety with a 100% score for my work to prevent animal cruelty!  http://www.hslf.org/assets/pdfs/humane-scorecard/humane-scorecard-preview-2019.pdf …

There is so much more to be done, and our work will continue. I am deeply grateful for the opportunity to serve the great people of CA 47th, and am more determined than ever to make great change in 2020.

I am particularly proud to see the House pass H.Res 326, my resolution protect the dream of a just and sustainable peace, with Israeli and Palestinian states living side by side. We took a stand against annexation and settlement expansion, against violence, and against hate.
And we passed critical measures to protect human rights—holding the President accountable for his conduct in Yemen and Syria and providing a voice for morality and democracy.

We passed HR 1 to protect our democracy, strengthen voter rights, end gerrymandering, fight the influence of money in politics and to combat foreign interference in our elections. Without a healthy democracy that responds to the voice of the people, we have nothing.

We passed legislation to restore the Paris Accord and to tackle the #ClimateCrisis: there is a long road ahead, but these first steps are critical. We can’t let this administration destroy our global leadership and waste precious time as global emissions increase.

We passed HR 4, to restore the Voting Rights Act, and to end the rising tide of disenfranchisement and discrimination across the country. Voter suppression is a critical threat to our democracy, which we can’t ignore.
We passed the Equality Act to ensure that no matter who you love or who you are, you are protected from discrimination by federal law. We will stand by our LGBTQ+ friends and neighbors.

We passed The Dream and Promise Act to ensure that DREAMers have a path to citizenship. We need to stand up to the administration’s relentless cruelty and defend these hardworking people—who enrich our communities.
We passed the Raise the Wage Act to responsibly boost the minimum wage to $15 per hour for 33 million Americans. No one who works full time should live in poverty or struggle to cover basic costs.
We reauthorized the Violence Against Women Act, and the Paycheck Fairness Act to ensure equal pay for equal work
We passed robust, bipartisan measures to tackle gun violence, and to institute universal background checks.

THREAD: I’m proud of the work we accomplished in the past year. House Democrats passed hundreds of bipartisan bills—and countless others, to deliver for the American people. Our investigators worked tirelessly to enforce the law.

Happy New Year! The coming year will be historic. As we celebrate this wonderful holiday, join me in reflecting and preparing for what lies ahead, and pledging to redouble our efforts to build a just and peaceful world for everyone.
